H0.text: Core is what remains of a star after a supernova.

H1.text: Large is the part of a star that remains after a supernova.

H2.text: Outer is the part of a star that remains after a supernova.

H3.text: Superficial is the part of a star that remains after a supernova.

A4.text: Such supernovae occur when the iron core of a massive star exceeds the Chandrasekhar limit and collapses to a neutron star.
